questions.question_text:
A product development team has team members located in four different countries. A senior manager is assigned the task of recruiting a project manager to manage this project and the virtual team.
Which skill is required for a project manager to successfully manage this team?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
why not A

Every Organization has a process for project execution, which varies from organization to organization. So, anyone who comes on board should have the ability & skills to implement the organizations standards & Process. Correct Option is therefore D. Even if the person has strong interpersonal skills & virtual team management abilities but lacks the essential skill set to manage it within the organizations project governance framework, then hiring him is futile exercise. Ideally any potential candidate should have both, but having Option D skills comes first, So that rules out option A

questions.question_text:
A project manager is assigned to a building construction project. The project manager has taken an agile course and wants to use agile practices in the project.
What should the project manager do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
lol without permission from executive so everything would come back to waterfall 
but again this is PMI test so i chose A

Selected Answer: A
A. Choose the agile practices that can be implemented in this type of construction project and apply them

Selected Answer: A
A. Choose the agile practices that can be implemented in this type of construction project and apply them

Answer: A

The project manager should first review the construction project to determine which agile practices can be applied in this particular context. Not all agile practices will be applicable to a construction project, and it's important to choose those that are appropriate. Once the applicable practices have been identified, the project manager can apply them accordingly to the project. Hiring a consultant or allocating additional budget for agile resources may not be necessary if the project manager has the necessary knowledge and expertise to apply agile practices appropriately. Similarly, assigning a scrum master may not be necessary if the project manager is already familiar with agile practices and can implement them without additional support.

The project manager does not have the power to hire a consultant; that is the business of HR.
The selected answer, A seems correct.

What should the project manager do to address this issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A makes better answer choice based on the type of meeting that is being held. A daily stand-up meeting that lasts for 15 minutes cannot make room for round robin-check-in as the PM will have to go round asking each one to have a say. this will not be efficient on the part of the PM when there is not enough time to do so. However, reflecting on the ground rule for meetings gives everyone a reminder of team's agreement as to what they have committed to do during meetings which gives everyone an opportunity to speak and share thoughts. The project manager should use a round-robin check-in to ensure all team members have an opportunity to speak up during the daily meeting. This technique allows each team member to provide a status update or share their thoughts in turn. The project manager should also encourage active participation by all team members by asking them specific questions about their work and addressing any concerns they may have.
Checking the ground rules of the meeting (option A) can be helpful in identifying any issues that may be hindering participation, but it may not directly address the issue of few team members actively participating.

However, it does not directly address the problem of only a few team members actively participating in the meetings, which is causing misunderstandings. Checking the ground rules can help to ensure that everyone understands how the meetings should be conducted, but it may not necessarily encourage more participation from the team members. Answer B, on the other hand, provides a specific solution to the problem by ensuring that everyone has the opportunity to speak during the meetings, which can improve communication and reduce misunderstandings.
